item.title: Lightning Round -- Assorted AI Topics
item.description:
Topic: Lightning Round – Assorted AI Topics
Presenter: Kevin Wang

Here, we talk about a wide range of topics in AI that haven’t received their own slide decks – the list includes reinforcement learning, optimization, adversarial machine learning, meta learning, active learning, multi-agent systems, and more. We hope that showcasing the breadth of AI research inspires you to dig deeper on your own and find what interests you!

You can view a recording of this lesson here.

Supplemental Resources

Lesson slides

item.title: Deep RL for Robotics: A Short Overview
item.description:
Speaker(s): Nikhil Devraj
Topic: A Brief Overview of Deep RL in Robotics

Deep reinforcement learning (RL) has emerged as a promising approach for autonomously acquiring complex behaviors from low level sensor observations. Although a large portion of deep RL research has focused on applications in video games and simulated control, which does not connect with the constraints of learning in real environments, deep RL has also demonstrated promise in enabling physical robots to learn complex skills in the real world.
This discussion focused predominantly on the following questions:
(1) What is deep RL and how does it relate to robotics?
(2) What are some examples of studies done with Deep RL in robotics?
(3) What are major challenges faced by researchers who apply deep RL to robotics?

This discussion is heavily inspired by Ibarz et al., although it does not dive into that level of detail.

You can find the recording of this talk here.

Supplemental Resources

Papers:
How to Train Your Robot with Deep Reinforcement Learning - Lessons We’ve Learned
Deep Reinforcement Learning for Robotic Manipulation with Asynchronous Off-Policy Updates
Reinforcement learning in robotics: a survey

Articles:
Medium: Reinforcement learning in robotics

Other:
Better slides (in our presenter’s opinion)
Deep RL Towards Robotics by Shane Gu (Google Brain)
Deep RL in Robotics with NVIDIA Jetson

item.title: Reinforcement Learning Applied to COVID-19 Optimization Problems
item.description:
Speaker(s): Nikhil Devraj
Topic: Reinforcement Learning for COVID-19 Optimization Problems

If you’re not living under a rock, you know that COVID-19 is ravaging current-day society and requires monumental efforts on all scales, be it from individuals or from entire governments. In particular, governments play a major role in helping control the spread of COVID-19 by instituting policies to help with efforts such as lockdown enforcement and vaccine distribution. During this talk Nikhil talked about some previously proposed approaches to modeling such policy problems as control problems that could be solved with reinforcement learning.

You can find a recording of this discussion here.

Supplemental Resources

Paper(s):
COVID-19 Pandemic Cyclic Lockdown Optimization Using Reinforcement Learning
Optimal policy learning for COVID-19 prevention using reinforcement learning
VacSIM: LEARNING EFFECTIVE STRATEGIES FOR COVID-19 VACCINE DISTRIBUTION USING REINFORCEMENT LEARNING

Article(s):
Reinforcement learning for Covid-19: Simulation and Optimal Policy

item.title: AlphaZero and its Impact on the World of Chess
item.description:
Speaker(s): Kevin Wang
Topic: AlphaZero and its Impact on Chess

The world was appalled when AlphaGo first played Lee Sedol in Go, winning 4 matches to 1. DeepMind subsequently released AlphaGo Zero, an iteration on AlphaGo that beat it 100-1. Going even further, they released AlphaZero, which learned how to play games such as Shogi and Chess. Kevin, an avid chess enthusiast, wanted to discuss what this meant for the Chess world.

You can find a recording of this discussion here.

Supplemental Resources

Paper(s):
Assessing Game Balance with AlphaZero: Exploring Alternative Rule Sets in Chess
Mastering Chess and Shogi by Self-Play with a General RL Algorithm

Video(s):
Video From DeepMind
AlphaZero VS AlphaZero || THE PERFECT GAME

item.title: Faculty Talk: Strategic Reasoning in Dynamic Environments
item.description:
Speaker(s): Prof. Michael Wellman
Topic: Strategic Reasoning in Dynamic Environments

Dr. Wellman presented about his group’s research, which generally specializes in game theory and multi-agent reasoning in dynamic environments. Much of his work lies in the domain of markets and commerce. You can find his group’s page here.

Prof. Wellman asked us not to post the recording publicly. A recording is available within our Slack channel, so please search in there if you’re interested. We apologize for any inconvenience.

Supplemental Resources

Article(s):
Empirical Game-Theoretic Analysis
Computational Finance
World with Autonomous Agents

Video(s):
“Artificially Intelligent Decision Makers in the Real World” with Michael Wellman & Bill Powers
